PRE COMMENCEMENT
Material Management & Storage
• Material to be stored in a dry, clean place and directly out of sunlight.
Subfloor Preperation

• Properly prepare the identified areas by mechanically abrading to remove surface contamination and any delaminating material. Surface should be prepared by abrasive grind and high-pressure wash or vacuum to allow for optimal bonding.
PRIMING APPLICATION - ENVIROSHIELD
Weather/RH
• Product to be applied at temperatures no less than 10C or no more than 35C.
• RH must be or greater than 50%
Product Mixing
• Mix Part A and Part B seperately. Add Part B, liquid hardener, to the Enviro Shield Part A base.
• Enviro Shield should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed with a suitable mixing paddle attached.
• Mix for 3 minutes or until uniform with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application.
Primer Application
• Apply a prime coat of Enviro Shield with a brush and roller at the application rate of 5m2/litre and allow to dry for at least 12 hours at 25C and 24 hours at 10C
• Applications of excessive build should be avoided, and material must not be allowed to pool on the substrate surface.
• When Priming, broadcast aggregate into wet primer to enhance holdup of the subsequent applied topping.
Enviro 250-NS COATING - FIRST COAT
Weather/RH
• Product to be applied at temperatures no less than 10C or no more than 35C.
• RH must be or greater than 50%
Product mixing
• Enviro 250-NS should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application.
• Mix to a uniform colour and consistency for a minimum of 3 minutes.
250-NS Application
• Enviro 250-NS to be applied by roller or brush to primed membrane.
• Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat.

• Applications where the coating is to be applied over joints where excessive movement is anticipated, apply an additional Bandage strip of Enviro 250-NS coating and Enviro Joint Band re-enforcing over the joint area prior to application of Enviro 250-NS Second coat.
• Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat
Enviro 250-NS COATING - SECOND COAT
Weather/RH
• Product to be applied at temperatures no less than 10C or no more than 35C.
• RH must be or greater than 50%
Product mixing
• Enviro 250-NS should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application.
• Mix to a uniform colour and consistency for a minimum of 3 minutes.
250-NS Application
• Enviro 250-NS to be applied by roller or brush to primed membrane.
• Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat
QA/TESTING
Inspection
• Visually examine the coating. Note and record the following properties: Overall evenness of coating appearance.
• DFT test of .06mm every 25m2

• Presence of entrapped contaminants in the coating such as dirt, concrete and construction waste, leaves, or other contaminants. Presence of pinholes or out-gassing, indicated by 1mm or larger diameter bubbles in the coating surface.
• Presence of uncured coating, indicated by soft, sticky, or liquid patches in the coating. A summary of on-site,in-situ tests and test results required.
Results:
– Evenness of Coating Finish.
– Leaves, Concrete Waste etc. Trapped in Coating not allowed.
– Minor Excessive Aeration of Coating Surface allowed. .
– Presence of Pinholes or Out-Gassing not allowed.
– Presence of Soft, Tacky or Uncured Coating not allowed.

PRIMING APPLICATION - ENVIROSHIELD
Weather/RH
• Product to be applied at temperatures no less than 10C or no more than 35C.
• RH must be or greater than 50%
Product Mixing
• Mix Part A and Part B seperately. Add Part B, liquid hardener, to the Enviro Shield Part A base.
• Enviro Shield should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed with a suitable mixing paddle attached.
• Mix for 3 minutes or until uniform with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application.
Primer Application
• Apply a prime coat of Enviro Shield with a brush and roller at the application rate of 5m2/litre and allow to dry for at least 12 hours at 25C and 24 hours at 10C
• Applications of excessive build should be avoided, and material must not be allowed to pool on the substrate surface.
• When Priming, broadcast aggregate into wet primer to enhance holdup of the subsequent applied topping.
